trailingComments.value:
*
 * This is a private command the shell script executes before running the run command in order to
 * validate the arguments and throw any necessary error. The reason we do this in two separated
 * commands is that the shell script takes all the output of the run command and tries to execute
 * it, so we can't include execptions in there.
 * @extends {CLICommand}

*
     * A description of the command, just to follow the interface as the command won't show up on
     * the help interface.
     * @type {string}

extra.rawValue: Validate the arguments before the shelll executes the task
extra.raw: 'Validate the arguments before the shelll executes the task'

right.value: Validate the arguments before the shelll executes the task

leadingComments.value:
*
     * A description of the command, just to follow the interface as the command won't show up on
     * the help interface.
     * @type {string}

extra.rawValue: Force the runner to use a production build even if projext is present
extra.raw: 'Force the runner to use a production build even if projext is present'

arguments.value: Force the runner to use a production build even if projext is present

extra.rawValue: Private flag to indicate that a production build was made
extra.raw: 'Private flag to indicate that a production build was made'

arguments.value: Private flag to indicate that a production build was made

leadingComments.value:
*
   * Class constructor.
   * @param {RunnerFile}    runnerFile    To validate if the file exists or not.
   * @param {Targets}       targets       To validate if a target exists or not.
   * @param {ProjextPlugin} projextPlugin To check if projext is present or not.

trailingComments.value:
*
   * Handle the execution of the command and validate all the arguments.
   * @param {?string} target The name of the target.

leadingComments.value: First, let's detect if the runner file exists.

trailingComments.value: If projext is not present and the file doesn't exist, there's nothing the plugin can do.

extra.rawValue: The runner file doesn't exist and projext is not present
extra.raw: 'The runner file doesn\'t exist and projext is not present'

arguments.value: The runner file doesn't exist and projext is not present

leadingComments.value: If projext is not present and the file doesn't exist, there's nothing the plugin can do.

trailingComments.value:
*
     * Then, if the runner file exists, validate the target, otherwise, we'll assume this is
     * running with projext present and the file is going to be generated on build.

leadingComments.value:
*
     * Then, if the runner file exists, validate the target, otherwise, we'll assume this is
     * running with projext present and the file is going to be generated on build.

*
   * Handle the execution of the command and validate all the arguments.
   * @param {?string} target The name of the target.

*
 * This is a private command the shell script executes before running the run command in order to
 * validate the arguments and throw any necessary error. The reason we do this in two separated
 * commands is that the shell script takes all the output of the run command and tries to execute
 * it, so we can't include execptions in there.
 * @extends {CLICommand}

comments.value:
*
 * This is a private command the shell script executes before running the run command in order to
 * validate the arguments and throw any necessary error. The reason we do this in two separated
 * commands is that the shell script takes all the output of the run command and tries to execute
 * it, so we can't include execptions in there.
 * @extends {CLICommand}

*
   * Class constructor.
   * @param {RunnerFile}    runnerFile    To validate if the file exists or not.
   * @param {Targets}       targets       To validate if a target exists or not.
   * @param {ProjextPlugin} projextPlugin To check if projext is present or not.

*
     * A description of the command, just to follow the interface as the command won't show up on
     * the help interface.
     * @type {string}

*
   * Handle the execution of the command and validate all the arguments.
   * @param {?string} target The name of the target.
First, let's detect if the runner file exists.
If projext is not present and the file doesn't exist, there's nothing the plugin can do.

*
     * Then, if the runner file exists, validate the target, otherwise, we'll assume this is
     * running with projext present and the file is going to be generated on build.

tokens.value:
*
 * This is a private command the shell script executes before running the run command in order to
 * validate the arguments and throw any necessary error. The reason we do this in two separated
 * commands is that the shell script takes all the output of the run command and tries to execute
 * it, so we can't include execptions in there.
 * @extends {CLICommand}

*
   * Class constructor.
   * @param {RunnerFile}    runnerFile    To validate if the file exists or not.
   * @param {Targets}       targets       To validate if a target exists or not.
   * @param {ProjextPlugin} projextPlugin To check if projext is present or not.

*
     * A description of the command, just to follow the interface as the command won't show up on
     * the help interface.
     * @type {string}
Validate the arguments before the shelll executes the task
Force the runner to use a production build even if projext is present
Private flag to indicate that a production build was made

*
   * Handle the execution of the command and validate all the arguments.
   * @param {?string} target The name of the target.
First, let's detect if the runner file exists.
If projext is not present and the file doesn't exist, there's nothing the plugin can do.
The runner file doesn't exist and projext is not present

*
     * Then, if the runner file exists, validate the target, otherwise, we'll assume this is
     * running with projext present and the file is going to be generated on build.
